text: if the idea of an expensive , clunky smartwatch does n't appeal to you , an italian firm has created a cheaper , slimline alternative in the form of a customisable bracelet . called hicon , the bangle features detachable buttons that can be slotted into holes around the band , and each button represents a different site or app , such as facebook or twitter . when a notification is received on the phone , the corresponding button lights up , and the band vibrates . scroll down for video . called hicon , the bangle -lrb- pictured -rrb- lights up when a notification is received on a connected smartphone . the band also vibrates when another wearer is nearhicon also vibrates when another user is nearby , and two bands can be connected , and ` become friends ' through a high-five or a handshake . hicon syncs with an iphone via bluetooth . detachable buttons can be slotted into holes around the 0.5-inch -lrb- 13 mm -rrb- bangle . each button represents a different site or app . when a notification is received on the phone , the corresponding button lights up . the band also vibrates when another wearer is nearby . bands can be connected , and friend requests sent , using a high-five or by shaking someone 's hand . hicon is due to retail for $ 89 -lrb- # 52 -rrb- and go on sale in november . it works with facebook , twitter , instagram , google + , whatsapp , skype , email , messaging , youtube , snapchat , and more . the band was created by milan-based things-lab and the firm has set up an indiegogo campaign to fund production of the gadget . it syncs with an iphone via bluetooth , and works with facebook , twitter , instagram , google + , whatsapp , skype , email , youtube , snapchat , and more . these buttons can be removed and replaced , depending on which apps are used the most . ` we check our smartphones , tablets and pcs every six minutes for a total of 150 times per day , ' said things-lab . ` what a waste of time ! ` ` we thought to solve this problem by creating a physical device , a bracelet , we call it hicon . it allows us to be always connected to our social networks . detachable buttons -lrb- pictured right -rrb- can be slotted into holes around the 0.5-inch -lrb- 13 mm -rrb- bangle -lrb- pictured left -rrb- . each button represents a different site or app and the bangle works with facebook , twitter , instagram , google + , whatsapp , skype , email , messaging , youtube , snapchat , and more . the band -lrb- pictured left -rrb- was created by milan-based things-lab and the firm has set up an indiegogo campaign to fund production of the gadget . it syncs with an iphone -lrb- pictured right -rrb- using bluetooth . the band is due to retail for $ 89 -lrb- # 52 -rrb- and go on sale in november . ` the idea is to bring the social -lsb- notifications -rsb- from the digital environment to the physical world . ` whenever you receive a notification on your smartphone , the icons blink . ' the 0.5-inch thick -lrb- 13mm -rrb- bracelet is made of silicone , making it waterproof and sand proof . the band will be sold in light -lrb- pictured left -rrb- , dark , placid blue -lrb- pictured right -rrb- , violet tulip , freesia , and celosia orange . a ` social matching ' feature also means contacts and social network preferences can be shared with other hicon users . it is expected to retail for $ 89 -lrb- # 52 -rrb- and go on sale in november , if the firm raises $ 60,000 -lrb- # 35,352 -rrb- through its indiegogo campaign . things-lab will ship internationally , but this will add $ 10 -lrb- # 6 -rrb- to the cost when shipped to the us , $ 15 -lrb- # 8 -rrb- to europe and $ 25 -lrb- # 14 -rrb- other countries . the band will be sold in light , dark , placid blue , violet tulip , fressia , and celosia orange . a ` social matching ' feature also means contacts and social network preferences can be shared with other hicon users .
